intro: Elleanthus decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive elleanthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often overlooked. Its botanical name reflects its ability to mimic other plants, possibly as a defense mechanism. Elleanthus decipiens is typically found in grasslands and open habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
